title: How Indiana WR Charlie Becker became Charlie B from Nashville, Tennessee
description: Former Father Ryan star Charlie Becker went from hardly playing to earning a nickname on national TV as an Indiana Hoosiers wide receiver.
fullText:
Charlie Becker went from hardly playing to becoming one of Indiana football's top receivers and even earning a nickname on national TV in the 2025 season.

The former Father Ryan star is expected to play in key role in No. 1 Indiana's quest to win its first national championship when the Hoosiers meet Miami on Jan. 19 (6:30 p.m CT, ESPN) at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, Florida.

Becker, a lanky 6-foot-4, sophomore, has become a fan favorite by making big catches at key times in several of the Hoosier's biggest wins down the stretch of the season.

Becker's breakout season is one of the reasons Indiana (15-0) is a substantial favorite over the Hurricanes (13-2).

CHARLIE BECKER EMERGES FOR INDIANA: Remember TSSAA football WR Charlie Becker? He's key part of Indiana football season

Here is everything you need to know about Indiana football's Charlie Becker:

Once Charlie Becker got onto the field it did not take long for him to build a chemistry with Indiana quarterback and Heisman Trophy winner Fernando Mendoza, perhaps because they're roommates.

After Becker's 33-yard reception in the fourth quarter against then-No. 1 Ohio State in the Big Ten Championship, which cinched a 13-10 win for the Hoosiers, Mendoza talked about his close relationship with Becker on ESPN.

"Every single day in summer we would always throw it before practice and at 7 a.m. on Sundays. Doing spots, doing routes," Mendoza said. "Now you see it's come into fruition. He's my roommate and I could not be happier for a young man."

After playing primarily on special teams through his first season and a half at Indiana, Charlie Becker found himself in a much bigger role when starting wide receiver Elijah Sarratt went down with a hamstring injury in late October.

Through the first seven games of the 2025 season Becker had a total of four catches for 70 yards and a touchdown. Since then Becker has 26 catches for 544 yards and three touchdowns. He is now the Hoosiers' third-leading receiver behind Sarratt and has the highest average yards per catch at 20.5.

Becker has four catches for 99 yards and two touchdowns in the Hoosiers' two CFP games.

Fittingly, after bursting onto the scene for Indiana on the Hoosiers' way to posting an undefeated regular season, Charlie Becker earned a nickname.

The always enthusiastic FOX Sports personality Gus Johnson tabbed Becker "Charlie B from Nashville Tennessee." It stuck. The catchphrase went viral as Indiana continued to make big news on its wat to earning a berth in the national championship game.

Charlie Becker's two greatest assets are his extraordinary pass catching ability and his speed.

As a high school senior he was the TSSAA Division II-AA 110-meter high hurdles state champion in 14.51 seconds and 300 low hurdles in 38.89 seconds. He also was part of the winning 4x400 relay team.

Becker's high school football coach Brian Rector said he clocked Becker consistently at 4.4 seconds in the 40-yard dash and as low as 4.2 at times.

Charlie Becker was a consensus three-star recruit and the No. 26 overall prospect in Tennessee in the 247Sports Composite as a high school senior.

Indiana was one of the few Power Four teams that recruited Becker. Vanderbilt also offered him a scholarship along with Ole Miss, Iowa, and Northwestern among Power Fours and then Appalachian State, Memphis, Middle Tennessee State, Memphis, UAB and Eastern Kentucky.

Charlie Becker's father David played three seasons in the Toronto Blue Jays organization as a catcher before enrolling at Ohio State where he played linebacker on the football team for one season (1995). David had been an all-state linebacker at Cincinnati Elder High School.

Two of David Becker's teammates at Ohio State were former Tennessee Titans coach and current New England Patriots coach Mike Vrabel, and former Titans All-Pro running back Eddie George, who won the Heisman Trophy that season.

Charlie Becker's older brother Cole was an all-state linebacker at Father Ryan, who led the team in tackles three straight seasons. He went on to play at Appalachian State.

Reach Mike Organ at 615-259-8021 or on X @MikeOrganWriter.

This article originally appeared on Nashville Tennessean: How Charlie Becker became a vital part of Indiana football CFP run

title: Patrick Reed on PGA Tour: 'Let's be honest: it's the best tour in the world'
description: Patrick Reed stands by the sentiment that he wants to be a worldwide player. It's why he would consider a return to the PGA Tour if given the chance.
fullText:
Patrick Reed stands by the sentiment that he wants to be a worldwide player. It's something he has not only said but followed up on throughout his career.

The 2018 Masters champion opened his 2026 campaign last week at the Dubai Invitational on the DP World Tour and will compete in this week's Dubai Desert Classic. Next month, he'll kick off his fifth season competing for LIV Golf, where he has one win in 45 career starts. Late last year, he also made starts on the Asian Tour.

Over the weekend, Reed was asked about a possible return to the PGA Tour. He's not eligible for the Returning Member Program, which only four players fit the criteria for, but that doesn't mean he hasn't thought about going back.

"I mean, of course; if it were up to me, I'd play everywhere," Reed told Golf Digest's Evin Priest. Then he continued: "I'm already playing on three tours, why not add one more? I always enjoyed my time out there on the PGA Tour.

"Let's be honest, out there, it's the best tour in the world. Look at what they've done in golf … I could see myself playing there at some point again. But right now, you just never know; everything's so fluid.”

Reed joking about competing on four tours is somewhat ironic, considering the Texan's reason for leaving the PGA Tour in the first place was centered around wanting to spend more time at home with his family. “It wears on you as an athlete, wears on you as a person, as a father, and this is for me, I feel like this is the best decision ever," Reed said in 2022. "Now I can compete at the highest level, but also prepare and get ready for every single event and be able to be home, and even though I'll be grinding at home getting ready, I'll be able to spend time with the kids."

But his praise for the PGA Tour is not too surprising. He has maintained, even since leaving, he wants to play all around the world, including back on the PGA Tour eventually.

"Right now, it's not even a decision,” Reed said. "That was for ’22 and on winners. So, I definitely would have to think about it … if that number (came) down to 2018. Right now, it's hard to say really what we're going to do or anything like that."

Last year, Reed tied for third at the Masters. He's a nine-time winner on the PGA Tour and has lifetime membership on the DP World Tour, which he received in 2019.

"Right now, the biggest thing is trying to play some good golf these (two) weeks, not only to solidify myself out here on DP, but to have a good momentum going into the year.”

For every LIV Golf event he competes in that is the same week as a DP World Tour event, Reed must pay fines for competing in a conflicting event. The amount of each fine is unknown, but Reed said having to pay those won't stop him.

“Me traveling and playing around the world ... it helps this tour, but also it's something I've always held true to my heart and wanted to do," Reed saod. "So, if that's what it takes, that's what it takes."

This article originally appeared on Golfweek: Patrick Reed calls PGA Tour 'the best tour in the world' in Dubai

title: Tennessee basketball is unranked for first time in five seasons
description: Tennessee basketball was unranked in the Associated Press Poll on Jan. 19, ending a streak of 90 consecutive weeks ranked.
fullText:
Tennessee basketball is unranked for the first time in five seasons.

The Vols (12-6, 2-3 SEC) fell out of the Associated Press poll on Jan. 19, ending an 90-week streak of being ranked. The streak was the second-longest in the nation behind only Houston and easily a program record for the longest run as a ranked program.

Tennessee had been ranked nonstop since the start of the 2021-22 season.

The Vols went 1-1 last week, beating Texas A&M 87-82 in overtime on Jan. 13 and losing 80-78 to Kentucky on Jan. 17. Tennessee fell out of the coaches poll on Jan. 12.

It was ranked in the top 10 a total of 50 times and the top five for 23 times in the streak. It had a program-record five-week stint as the No. 1 team in the nation during the 2024-25 season.

The Vols were ranked in the top 10 for 18 straight weeks to close the 2024-25 season. They also spent 11 weeks in the top five last season, the second most in a season in program history behind the 14 weeks in the top five in the 2018-19 season.

UT was ranked in the top-10 37 times between the 2023-24 and 2024-25 seasons, which spanned 47 polls.

The streak started when Tennessee entered the poll ranked No. 18 before the 2021-22 season. The Vols dropped to No. 24 on Jan. 17, 2022, the closest they came to falling out during the streak. They finished the season rolling and rose all the way to No. 5 in the final AP poll after winning the SEC Tournament.

UT entered the 2022-23 season ranked No. 11 but dropped to No. 22 in back-to-back polls. It jumped into the top 10 again two weeks later and remained ranked in the top 10 for 11 straight weeks before finishing No. 20 in the final poll.

The Vols opened the 2023-24 season ranked No. 9 and were only ranked outside the top 10 twice in the 21 weeks of the poll. They finished ranked No. 5.

Tennessee began the 2024-25 season as the No. 12 team in the nation. It spent two straight weeks at No. 11 before hopping into the top 10, where it spent the remainder of the season. It reached No. 1 on Dec. 9, 2024, and held the spot until Jan. 13, 2025, following a loss at Florida. It finished No. 5 for the second straight season following a second consecutive Elite Eight appearance.

Mike Wilson covers University of Tennessee athletics. Email him at michael.wilson@knoxnews.com and follow him on X @ByMikeWilson. If you enjoy Mike’s coverage, consider a digital subscription that will allow you access to all of it.

This article originally appeared on Knoxville News Sentinel: Tennessee basketball is unranked for first time in five seasons

title: 2026 NBA All-Star Game starters: Live updates, official announcement, voting results, USA vs World, analysis
description: During NBC's quadruple-header of Martin Luther King Day games, the All-Star Game starters also will be announced.
fullText:
Fans from around the globe cast their ballots, picking who should start in the NBA All-Star Game next month in Los Angeles. Those fan votes (50% of the total) — combined with votes from NBA players (25%) and select media (25%) — have chosen the 10 All-Star Game starters. There are five starters from the Eastern Conference and five from the West (even though those players will later be divided into two USA and one World team for the new format, more on that below).

Those All-Star Game starters will be unveiled today on NBC, read by the NBA Showtime crew live on set at 2 p.m. Eastern. This will be right before the tip-off of the Oklahoma City at Cleveland game, part of a quadruple header of Martin Luther King Day games on NBC and Peacock.

Refresh this page, where we will have all the details on who the starters will be, as well as analysis of those selections.

Now that the fans have had their say, it falls to the coaches around the league.

NBA coaches will vote to choose the seven reserve (or bench) players from each conference. The results of the vote and the names of the remaining NBA All-Stars will be announced next week on NBC.

Those starters and reserves will then be divided up into three teams as part of a new USA vs. World All-Star Game format. Two international players, Luka Doncic in the West and Giannis Antetokounmpo in the East, were the top vote-getters among fans.

While the idea of a USA vs. international players All-Star Game format has been talked about for years, 2026 felt like the right time.

That's because the NBA All-Star Game returns to NBC and debuts on Peacock in the middle of the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics. That was a perfect setup for the first-of-its-kind All-Star Game format.

The 24 All-Star players will be divided into three teams — two USA teams and one world team — that will compete in a round-robin tournament of four 12-minute games. Each of the three teams will have a minimum of eight players (if the USA or World teams are short on players, the league office will select one or more players to reach the required number).

At the end of the round-robin, the two top teams will play a championship game (the fourth 12-minute game of the day) for the title.

All-Star weekend tips off on Feb. 13 with the Rising Stars at the Intuit Dome at 6 p.m. PT, featuring the league's top first- and second-year players. Also on the 13th is the NBA All-Star Celebrity Game, featuring stars from media, sports and entertainment at the Kia Forum. The Forum also hosts the fifth annual NBA HBCU Classic at 8 p.m. that night.

On Saturday, Feb. 14, All-Star Saturday night — featuring the Skills Challenge, 3-point Contest and the Dunk Contest — will take place at the Intuit Dome.

The 75th NBA All-Star Game will take place on Sunday, Feb. 15, at 5 p.m. Eastern, earlier than in previous years, leading into more coverage of the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics.

Peacock NBA Monday will stream up to three Monday night games each week throughout the regular season. Coast 2 Coast Tuesday presents doubleheaders on Tuesday nights throughout the regular season on NBC and Peacock. On most Tuesdays, an 8 p.m. ET game will be on NBC stations in the Eastern and Central time zones, and an 8 p.m. PT game on NBC stations in the Pacific and often Mountain time zones. Check local listings each week. Both games will stream live nationwide on Peacock. NBC Sports will launch Sunday Night Basketball across NBC and Peacock on Feb. 1, 2026. For a full schedule of the NBA on NBC and Peacock, click here.

title: Former Saints defensive coordinator emerges in Stanford coach search
description: The New Orleans Saints have had a wide array of coaches recently, and one former coordinator may have another job lined up soon.
fullText:
Over the course of the past few seasons, the New Orleans Saints have gone through a wide variety of coaches, trying to not only find their replacement for Sean Payton, but also the remaining staff members. While they now have Kellen Moore, who showed some promise in the second half of the year, the previous candidates left a lot to be desired, notably Dennis Allen, who, in his first season, went 7-10 and missed out on the playoffs.

One of the members of that staff was coach Kris Richard, who at the time was promoted to co-defensive coordinator, focusing on the secondary. He has bounced around the league since he started in the NFL as a coach back in 2010 with the Seattle Seahawks, as their assistant defensive backs coach. Now, he has the opportunity to get a pretty substantial new spot, as it is being reported that he is one of the targets for Stanford's defensive coordinator position. CBS Sports insider Matt Zenitz had the scoop.

Longtime NFL assistant Kris Richard is the target for the Stanford defensive coordinator job, sources tell @CBSSports.

Has been an NFL DC with the Seahawks. Has also been an NFL secondary coach and/or defensive pass game coordinator for teams like the Cowboys, Saints and Jaguars pic.twitter.com/YsQdf3PQK6

— Matt Zenitz (@mzenitz) January 16, 2026

While he does not have any specific links back to Stanford or Andrew Luck, Richard does have ties to California, being born and growing up there, going to USC as a student-athlete, and returning as a graduate assistant from 2008 to 2009. The only indirect link is that Andrew Luck played against a Richard-coached secondary when the Indianapolis Colts took on the Seattle Seahawks in Week 5 of the 2013 season.

In that game, the Colts won 34-28, with Luck passing for 229 yards on 29 attempts with 2 touchdowns and no interceptions, including a 73-yard touchdown to T.Y. Hilton. Regardless, having Richard on the Stanford staff would certainly bring a wealth of NFL experience to the collegiate program, looking to form a strong identity under Luck.

This article originally appeared on Saints Wire: Report: Stanford targeting former Saints, Cowboys DC Kris Richard

title: Steelers bringing in Dolphins DC Anthony Weaver for second interview
description: The Pittsburgh Steelers are giving a second interview to another character.
fullText:
The Pittsburgh Steelers continue their search for a new head coach after Mike Tomlin stepped down following the team’s wild card loss to the Houston Texans. The Steelers have put in interview requests for nine different candidates. It has been reported that Minnesota Vikings defensive coordinator Brian Flores is getting a second interview with the team, and now the Steelers are doing a second interview with another defensive coordinator.

Per Ian Rapoport, the Steelers are expected to bring in Miami Dolphins defensive coordinator Anthony Weaver for a second interview.

“Dolphins DC Anthony Weaver is expected to have a second, in-person interview with the Steelers for their HC position this week, source said,” Rapoport reports.

#Dolphins DC Anthony Weaver is expected to have a second, in-person interview with the #Steelers for their HC position this week, source said. pic.twitter.com/O9GFwlKUSD

— Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) January 19, 2026

Weaver has been the Dolphins’ defensive coordinator since 2024. Before that, he was the defensive line coach and assistant head coach with the Baltimore Ravens from 2022-23. From 2016-20, he served as the Houston Texans’ defensive line coach and was the team’s defensive coordinator in his final season.

Be sure to bookmark Behind the Steel Curtain for all the latest news, breakdowns, and more!

title: 5 Pittsburgh Steelers become free agents as contracts expire
description: Those players are now free to sign reserve/future contract with any NFL team.
fullText:
This story initially appeared on SteelersNow.com.

Five Pittsburgh Steelers players became free agents on Monday, as the team did not renew their practice squad contracts for the 2026 season.

Tight end Jaheim Bell, cornerback Tre Flowers, wide receiver Brandon Johnson, running back Trey Sermon and tight end Matt Sokol all had their practice squad contracts expire, according to the NFL transactions page for Monday.

Those players are now free to sign reserve/future contract with any NFL team. They could also still return to the Steelers.

title: Bo Nix injury: 5 things we know about QB's ankle and surgeon
description: Here's what we know about Bo Nix's ankle injury and surgery.
fullText:
While there are several unknowns about the injury to Denver Broncos quarterback Bo Nix, we wanted to take a look at the things we do know ahead of the Broncos' AFC championship week preparation against the New England Patriots.

1. Sean Payton announced Bo Nix has a fracture in his ankle: Nix injured his ankle on a two-yard loss in overtime, just before throwing a deep pass to wide receiver Marvin Mims that resulted in a pass interference, setting up a game-winning field goal. After the play, Nix came up limping slightly, and (looking back) he had a much more pronounced limp after centering the ball for kicker Wil Lutz's field goal attempt.

2. Bo Nix is scheduled for surgery on Tuesday: In his second media appearance of the night on Saturday, Payton confirmed Nix will have surgery on Tuesday in Birmingham, Alabama, performed by Dr. Norman Waldrop. The surgery will end Nix's 2025 season, a campaign that ended up in the Broncos' and league history books.

3. Dr. Norman Waldrop is well-known among NFL quarterbacks: Dr. Waldrop was the surgeon who performed the turf toe surgery of Cincinnati Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow earlier this season. Burrow came back ahead of schedule, and played the final six games of the 2025 campaign. Dr. Waldrop has also worked on Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa and former Tennessee Titans quarterback Ryan Tannehill, among others. Waldrop has also worked with the New Orleans Saints.

4. Dr. Waldrop previously practiced in Colorado: Dr. Waldrop also practiced at Vail, Colorado's The Steadman Clinic, a center "world-renowned" for its surgeons & Orthopaedic Surgery. Waldrop was mentored by Dr. Thomas Clanton, who is known for his work on the foot and ankle. Clanton also served as the team orthopaedist for the Houston Texans.

5. Bo Nix's recovery timeline: As Payton is wont to do, he played the details of Nix's recovery close to the vest.  “Listen, the surgeon gets his hands on the X-rays,” said Payton during a media conference call on Sunday. “We have enough information for everyone. The focus is on the next week’s game.”

For now, the Broncos will do exactly what Payton said, and turn their attention toward the Patriots. The two teams have been nipping at each other's heels through the regular season. Now, they are set to meet and play for the right to be the AFC's representative in Super Bowl LX, and Nix will focus on surgery and recovery.

Social: Follow Broncos Wire on Facebook and Twitter/X! Did you know: These 25 celebrities are Broncos fans.

This article originally appeared on Broncos Wire: Bo Nix injury: 5 things we know about QB's ankle and surgeon

title: Rams' playoff win vs. Bears is bad news for Browns, Raiders, Ravens, Steelers coaching searches
description: The Los Angeles Rams' playoff win over the Chicago Bears is horrible news for the Cleveland Browns, Las Vegas Raiders, Baltimore Ravens, and Pittsburgh Steelers' ongoing head coaching searches.
fullText:
Rams' playoff win vs. Bears is bad news for Browns, Raiders, Ravens, Steelers coaching searches originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Rams' coaching staff is filled with a ton of future head coaches, including passing game coordinator Nate Scheelhaase.

Scheelhaase has been with the Rams since 2024 and is in his first season as the passing game coordinator in 2025. Los Angeles' passing attack is one of the most dynamic in football, and Scheelhaase has quickly established himself as a promising up-and-coming offensive mind in the Sean McVay coaching tree.

Due to his success this season, Scheelhaase has received head coaching interest from multiple franchises, including the Cleveland Browns, Las Vegas Raiders, Baltimore Ravens, and Pittsburgh Steelers.

However, those teams were dealt some bad news on Sunday after the Rams beat the Chicago Bears in the divisional round.

With Los Angeles moving on to the NFC Championship game, Scheelhaase won't be available for second interviews this week. According to NFL rules, he must wait till after the conference championship game.

If the Rams make the Super Bowl, Scheelhaase can talk to teams during the bye week in between the big game, but can't be officially hired until after the season.

With Scheelhaase being a coveted candidate, it is incredibly detrimental to the Browns, Raiders, Ravens, and Steelers' head coaching searches that the Rams assistant coach can't do second interviews anytime soon.

We'll see if any of the teams above are willing to wait for Scheelhaase or even make him a finalist for their jobs. The NFL head coaching carousel is quickly moving, so these franchises must move quickly.

fullText:
We officially have names to look forward to with WTGL.

To say this list is loaded is quite the understatement.

title: Mercedes F1 star Kimi Antonelli shares moment with Ja Morant after NBA London Game
description: Kimi Antonelli was among the high-profile guests at the NBA London Game on Sunday. The rising Mercedes Formula 1 driver met Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant after the team’s win over the Orlando Magic.
fullText:
Kimi Antonelli was among the high-profile guests at the NBA London Game on Sunday.

The rising Mercedes Formula 1 driver met Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant after the team’s win over the Orlando Magic.

The Italian teenager attended the game at The O2 Arena, which marked the NBA’s first regular-season fixture in London since 2019.

The meeting between Antonelli and Morant quickly caught the attention of fans online, blending two worlds of elite sport.

Antonelli met Morant following the Grizzlies’ 126–109 win over the Orlando Magic, with the two sharing a short exchange.

Antonelli told the Grizzlies point guard: “I wear number 12 as well.” Morant replied: “That’s why we are who we are.”

The moment was widely shared on social media, with fans praising the easy chemistry between the rising Formula 1 driver and the NBA superstar.

Antonelli, who also wears the number 12 in F1, is viewed as one of Mercedes’ future stars, while Morant has long been one of basketball’s most talked-about players.

Their meeting added to the star-studded atmosphere of the London showcase, which drew global athletes and celebrities from football, motorsport, and entertainment.

Back on the court, Ja Morant marked his return from injury with a commanding performance, scoring 24 points and dishing out 13 assists.

The Memphis guard was in control throughout, combining trademark speed and athleticism with efficient playmaking.

Jock Landale added 21 points and 8 rebounds, while Jaren Jackson Jr finished with 17 points as the Grizzlies avenged their earlier loss to Orlando in Berlin.

The victory capped off a great week for the NBA’s European showcase, and for those watching, including Kimi Antonelli, it was a night to remember.

title: It’s unanimous: Arizona men’s basketball locks up AP No. 1 ranking
description: Arizona is the No. 1 team in the country. And this time, it’s unanimous. The Wildcats received every first-place vote in this week’s Associated Press Top 25. UConn is ranked No.
fullText:
Arizona is the No. 1 team in the country. And this time, it’s unanimous.

The Wildcats received every first-place vote in this week’s Associated Press Top 25. UConn is ranked No. 2, followed by No. 3 Michigan, No. 4 Purdue and No. 5 Duke.

Arizona has been ranked No. 1 in the AP poll for seven straight weeks, marking the program’s second-longest run atop the rankings. In 2013-14, the Wildcats were ranked No. 1 for eight straight weeks.

Arizona can tie that mark if it takes care of business this week with home matchups against Cincinnati on Wednesday and West Virginia on Saturday.

Arizona is one of six Big 12 programs ranked, joined by No. 6 Houston, No. 9 Iowa State, No. 12 Texas Tech, No. 13 BYU and No. 19 Kansas. UCF, who Arizona beat 84-77 on Saturday, received 14 votes.

The UA is one of three remaining undefeated teams. The other unbeatens are No. 8 Nebraska and No. 25 Miami (Ohio).

Arizona was also the unanimous No. 1 team in the USA Today Coaches poll this week.

title: Seahawks lose Zach Charbonnet to 'significant' knee injury ahead of NFC Championship vs. Rams
description: Zach Charbonnet led the Seahawks with 12 rushing touchdowns in the regular season.
fullText:
The Seattle Seahawks dismantled the rival San Francisco 49ers in the divisional round of the playoffs Saturday, but it came with a cost. Running back Zach Charbonnet sustained a "significant knee injury" and will miss the rest of the playoffs, Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald confirmed Monday.

Charbonnet, 25, led team with 12 rushing touchdowns during the regular season.

Seahawks HC Mike Macdonald with a tough injury update on RB Zach Charbonnet on @SeattleSports 

"The bummer is Charbs. He's got a significant knee injury unfortunately. Breaks your heart. He's going to need surgery. He's going to have a long road back."

— Maura Dooley (@Maura_Dool) January 19, 2026

While Macdonald didn't reveal the exact nature of the injury, he said Charbonnet would face "a long road back," potentially hinting at the running back missing time next season.

Throughout the regular season, Charbonnet and Kenneth Walker combined to give the Seahawks a fearsome rushing attack. The team ranked 10th in the NFL with 2,096 rushing yards in 2025. Walker led the way with 1,027 yards, but Charbonnet was the hammer, scoring 12 of the team's 19 rushing scores.

Since being selected in the second round of the 2023 NFL Draft, Charbonnet has emerged as a strong power option and the perfect complement to the shifty Walker. After a quiet rookie season, Charbonnet showed promise in his second year, rushing for 569 yards and scoring eight touchdowns while filling in for an injured Walker.

Both players stayed healthy in 2025, but that didn't stop Charbonnet from putting up the best season of his career. The third-year pro rushed for a career-high 730 yards and scored 12 touchdowns.

With the Seahawks securing the No. 1 seed in the NFC, Charbonnet was able to rest during the wild-card games. He returned to action against the 49ers, but carried the ball just five times for 20 yards in the contest. He left the game late in the first half, after taking a big hit. Macdonald said he was optimistic about Charbonnet's injury after the contest, but that the running back would undergo further evaluation.

That evaluation apparently revealed a much more worrisome injury, ending Charbonnet's season.

title: How Texans’ DeMeco Ryans Explained Controversial Late-Game Decisions
description: The Houston Texans didn’t seem to show enough urgency as their season slipped away in Sunday’s AFC Divisional Round loss to the New England Patriots. Houston punted twice in the fourth quarter while trailing 28-16, which held up as the final score at Gillette Stadium. DeMeco Ryans drew criticism for his conservative approach, especially after […]
fullText:
The Houston Texans didn’t seem to show enough urgency as their season slipped away in Sunday’s AFC Divisional Round loss to the New England Patriots.

Houston punted twice in the fourth quarter while trailing 28-16, which held up as the final score at Gillette Stadium. DeMeco Ryans drew criticism for his conservative approach, especially after the Texans gave the ball back to the Patriots with less than five minutes remaining in regulation.

After the game, a reporter asked Ryans about punting on 4th-and-6 at Houston’s own 27 early in the fourth quarter. The head coach justified his choice, per New England’s transcript.

“At the end of the day, I make decisions there in the game for us to get the ball back, get the ball to our defense and see if we can make a play,” Ryans said.

That first punt was an understandable call, as C.J. Stroud had already thrown four interceptions. Meanwhile, his top-ranked defense forced three turnovers and two more Drake Maye fumbles that the Patriots recovered.

Had the Texans failed to convert that fourth down, a highly feasible outcome since they averaged just 3.3 yards per play on Sunday, the Patriots would have immediately received the ball in scoring position with a chance to ice the game. But while the Patriots didn’t add points on their next drive, they instead burned 6:09 minutes off the clock.

Ryans was backed into a corner when facing two bad choices later in the fourth quarter. Rather than attempting a 4th-and-18 with his team in desperation mode, he effectively raised the white flag by punting.

The Texans didn’t get the ball back until after the two-minute warning. Not enough time remained to mount a comeback, but they quickly turned the ball over on downs anyway.

Attempting those fourth downs likely would not have made a difference, but at least the Texans would have gone down swinging. They’ll watch the Patriots play the Denver Broncos in the AFC Championship Game this Sunday.

Drake Maye, Patriots Must Navigate Historically Tough Defenses To Make Super Bowl

title: Jayson Tatum Dunks With Ease In Latest Workout Video From Detroit
description: Boston Celtics love whenever new Jayson Tatum workout footage surfaces. A particularly enjoyable instance of this occurred last month when photo and video emerged of Tatum working out with Brad Stevens in Indiana. Well, with the Celtics in Detroit to take on the Pistons on Monday night, new footage has hit the internet of Tatum […]
fullText:
Boston Celtics love whenever new Jayson Tatum workout footage surfaces. A particularly enjoyable instance of this occurred last month when photo and video emerged of Tatum working out with Brad Stevens in Indiana.

Well, with the Celtics in Detroit to take on the Pistons on Monday night, new footage has hit the internet of Tatum getting another workout in, this time in the Motor City.

There have been multiple videos surfacing on X, but a tasteful one comes from FanSided’s Jack Simone, as it shows Tatum rising up with ease for a dunk, thereby showcasing his regained athleticism and agility.

Tatum dunk alert pic.twitter.com/4FMdEh6gbF

— Jack Simone (@JackSimoneNBA) January 19, 2026

It’s now been over eight months since Tatum tore his Achilles against the New York Knicks in the playoffs.

Neither Tatum nor the Celtics have made any sort of announcement about an expected return date for the All-NBA wing, but media outlets have collectively speculated that a March return to the hardwood is not out of the question for Tatum.

With the Celtics holding down the No. 2 seed in the East without Tatum, adding JT to the mix could put Boston in prime position to seriously contend and get back to the NBA Finals, a place they’ve been recently in both 2024 and 2022.

Tatum’s 2024-25 season was stellar, despite it ending in horrific fashion. JT averaged 26.8 points, 8.7 rebounds, and 6.0 assists across 72 games, marking career highs in rebounds and assists. He secured his sixth All-Star nod and propelled the Celtics to a 60-win record.

Throughout his career, spanning eight seasons all with the Celtics since being drafted third overall in 2017, Jayson has averaged 23.6 points, 7.3 rebounds, and 3.8 assists per game in 585 contests.

title: Guardiola on 'important' Guehi, Champions League focus & artificial pitch
description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has been speaking to the media before Tuesday's Champions League game against Bodo/Glimt at Aspmyra Stadion (kick-off 17:45 GMT).  Guardiola confirmed that Phil Foden has "a little bit broken his bones" in his hand but will wear protection on it and is fit for the game.
fullText:
Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has been speaking to the media before Tuesday's Champions League game against Bodo/Glimt at Aspmyra Stadion (kick-off 17:45 GMT).

Here are the key lines from his news conference:

Guardiola confirmed that Phil Foden has "a little bit broken his bones" in his hand but will wear protection on it and is fit for the game.

On the signing of defender Marc Guehi from Crystal Palace, which was confirmed on Monday: "Top, top central defender. He has played for the national team. Thanks to the club for bringing him here. He has the perfect age for many years now, can play right, left. I know he wanted to choose us. With problems in the back for next few months, it is important he is here."

He added: "I'm pretty sure if he had a long contract at Crystal Palace it would have been impossible [to sign him now], but the fact that it's six months, end of contract, the situation was easier in those terms. But of course, Crystal Palace and Man City have to agree and after, the player decided to come. Otherwise, even in that situation, it would not be possible."

Guardiola insisted it is the "same feeling" now about the Manchester derby defeat as it was after the match: "They were better. [We were] immediately thinking of this different competition and the chance to finish in the top eight tomorrow. We didn't talk one word about Manchester United before coming here. Now, it is another competition. Now, we have chance to qualify in the top eight and that is enough of an argument to focus on tomorrow and not the past."

The City boss said the win against Newcastle at St James' Park in the Carabao Cup showed they "are ready" as a team, but then a few days later against Manchester United showed "we are not ready". He feels this "inconsistency is normal" with injuries and added: "When you have the situation we have now then you have ups and downs. If you accept it then the team grows up. It happens."

Asked about playing on Bodo/Glimt's artificial pitch, Guardiola responded: "It is different. It is why we train the night before in the stadium when we never train in the stadium the night before, but we need to see how the ball bounces... If I start to cry for that situation, then we wouldn't achieve what happens in the past."

On Oscar Bobb's future: "I don't have an idea [about his situation]. He says he is not fit, so he is not fit."

Listen to full commentary of Bodo/Glimt v Manchester City on Tuesday from 17:45 GMT on BBC Sounds

title: Men's college basketball rankings on Jan. 19: Updated Coaches Poll, AP Top 25
description: After Iowa State and Vanderbilt fell from the ranks of undefeated men's basketball teams, here's a look at the latest Coaches Poll and AP Top 25
fullText:
While college football is set to crown its national championship on Monday, Jan. 19 after Indiana's game against Miami, the race for men's college basketball's ultimate prize is heating up about two months before the start of the NCAA Tournament.

In a week, the number of undefeated teams in the sport dwindled from five to three, with No. 2 Iowa State and No. 8 Vanderbilt both suffering two losses. The Cyclones were blown out 84-63 on the road by Kansas before following that up with a 79-70 setback at Cincinnati four days later. The Commodores, meanwhile, lost by 16 on the road against Texas and fell 98-94 at home to reigning national champion Florida.

No. 1 Arizona continued its perfect start to the season, moving to 18-0 with wins against rival Arizona State and at UCF. No. 10 Nebraska, the only other unbeaten team from a power conference, also kept its unblemished record intact, drubbing Oregon and Northwestern by a combined 54 points.

REQUIRED READING: NCAA tournament bracketology: Race for No. 1 seed leads March Madness projection

Then there's the nation's unlikeliest undefeated squad, Miami (Ohio), which moved to 19-0 thanks to a 105-102 overtime thriller over Buffalo.

Will it be enough to get the RedHawks ranked? And how will results elsewhere in the country affect the newest batch of national rankings?

Here's a look at the updated USA TODAY Sports Coaches Poll and AP Top 25 for men's college basketball:

First-place votes are in parentheses.

Others receiving votes: Iowa 52; Wisconsin 20; Miami (Ohio) 19; Utah State 14; Villanova 10; Tennessee 10; Saint Mary's 9; Miami (FL) 8; Texas A&M 5; Kentucky 5; SMU 4; Seton Hall 2; UCF 1; George Mason 1

Others receiving votes: Wisconsin 64; St. John's 64; Iowa 30; Kentucky 27; Tennessee 20; Utah State 15; UCF 14; Miami 10; George Mason 10; Saint Mary's 5; SMU 3; Villanova 3; Texas A&M 2; NC State 1

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Men's college basketball rankings: Updated Coaches Poll, AP Top 25

title: 5th Spurs player ruled out of Arsenal clash after injury update
description: Richarlison and Ben Davies have become the fourth and fifth Tottenham Hotspur players to be ruled out of the north London derby, still more than a month before the game.Photo by Justin Setterfield/Get...
fullText:
Last week, we covered reports that Tottenham Hotspur had suffered three injuries to key players, with two almost immediately ruled out of the next north London derby.

First, Mohammed Kudus suffered a thigh injury, with Thomas Frank confirming it’s a tendon injury that will rule the player out until after the March international break.

Then, Rodrigo Bentancur tore his hamstring, with Sami Mokbel reporting for the BBC that the midfielder will need surgery and at least three months on the sidelines.

Richarlison then suffered an apparent hamstring injury as Spurs were eliminated from the FA Cup by Aston Villa, and further assessment has confirmed the forward is also facing a lengthy spell on the sidelines.

“Richy, unfortunately, got a hamstring injury which will keep him out for up to seven weeks,” Frank confirmed ahead of the weekend’s fixtures.

A seven-week absence from the date of Frank’s comments would mean a return on March 5th, but even just six weeks out would mean missing the north London derby against Arsenal on February 22nd.

Then Ben Davies has also been ruled out after Spurs confirmed he’s having surgery on an ankle fracture, and James Maddison remains out with his ACL injury, meaning at least five Spurs players are expected to miss the game.

Most of Spurs’ other injured players should be back by that point in mid-February, but there’s some uncertainty over exactly when Dejan Kulusevski will be fit again.

title: NBA All-Star rosters 2026: Live updates on starters, voting results for U.S. vs. World competition
description: The Sporting News has you covered with the starters and voting results for the 2026 NBA All-Star Game.
fullText:
NBA All-Star rosters 2026: Live updates on starters, voting results for U.S. vs. World competition originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The NBA is trying its hand at a brand new All-Star Game format in 2026, but the honor of being named a starter remains unchanged. As in years' past, five players from each conference receive the starter label, even though 15 players will actually start as part of the league's three-team format.

If the early voting returns were any indication, fans expect the World team to have an advantage over the two USA teams on All-Star Weekend. Luka Doncic, Giannis Antetokounmpo and Nikola Jokic were the top three vote-getters in the NBA's final update on Jan. 7, with Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Victor Wembanyama also not far behind.

For the Americans, Jalen Brunson put together a strong showing in early voting returns, while Stephen Curry was near the top of the balloting in the West even as he approaches his 38th birthday.

Which 10 players are 2026 NBA All-Star Game starters? The Sporting News is tracking the full results below.

MORE: Highest-scoring NBA All-Star Games in history

This section will be updated when the results are revealed.

Fans voted on starters for the 2026 NBA All-Star Game from Dec. 17 to Jan. 14, with votes counting for three times the value of a normal vote on five particular days. The All-Star ballot included two guards and three frontcourt players from each conference.

The selection process remained the same as previous years, with fan vote accounting for 50 percent, media vote accounting for 25 percent and player votes accounting for the final 25 percent toward determining the five starters in each conference.

The NBA All-Star Game once again has a new format, and it means the honor of being named one of the 10 starters is mostly ceremonial.

The NBA is breaking in a new USA vs. World format comprised of three teams: two eight-man rosters of American players and one eight-man roster of international players. The teams will play a round-robin format to determine who will advance to the championship game. All games will be played on Sunday, Feb. 15.

If all three teams are tied after the round-robin format, point differential will be used to determine which teams go to the championship game. Each game will be 12 minutes, adding up to the equivalent of a 48-minute game of basketball.

Location: Intuit Dome, Inglewood, CA

The 2026 NBA All-Star will tip off at 5 p.m. ET on Sunday, Feb. 15 from the Los Angeles Clippers' Intuit Dome. The game has an earlier start time this year to fit around NBC's Winter Olympics coverage.

NBA All-Star Celebrity Game, 7 p.m. ET

NBA Rising Stars Game, 9 p.m. ET

NBA HBCU Classic (Hampton vs. NC A&T), 11 p.m. ET

NBA All-Star Saturday Night, 5 p.m. ET

title: Seahawks get devastating news on Zach Charbonnet after injury vs. 49ers
description: This is a brutal outcome for the Seahawks.
fullText:
Seahawks get devastating news on Zach Charbonnet after injury vs. 49ers originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Seattle Seahawks blew out the San Francisco 49ers, 41-6, but in the process of beating their division rival in the NFC Divisional round, they got some bad news.

Zach Charbonnet went down with an injury in the middle of this game, and it didn't look good. While there wasn't any reporting after the fact on Charbonnet, Monday brought some terrible news.

As Maura Dooley of Seattle Sports shared on Twitter/x, head coach Mike Macdonald revealed that Charbonnet has a significant injury, will need surgery, and is going to miss the rest of the playoffs.

"The bummer is Charbs," Macdonald said. "he's got a significant knee injury, unfortunately. Breaks your heart. He's going to need surgery. He's going to have a long road back."

This is a brutal blow for the Seahawks. While Kenneth Walker is a great running back, the duo with Chrabonnet was finally finding its stride late in the season.

Before the injury, Charbonnet was a big part of the offense for Seattle. He had five attempts for 20 yards on the ground before his unfortunate knee injury.

Walker will now take complete control over the backfield, and coming off a 116-yard, three-touchdown performance, the Seahawks are going to need him to continue producing in the playoffs.

More: 49ers vs. Seahawks final score, results: Kenneth Walker, dominant defense help Seattle cruise past San Francisco

Walker has 1,027 rushing yards this season with five touchdowns, while Charbonnet had 730 yards and 12 touchdowns this year.

The Seahawks are losing a key goal-line back for the NFC Championship game due to a brutal injury to the young Seahawks running back.

Velus Jones Jr. will get some run behind this offensive line, but with Charbonnet set to miss the rest of the year, the Seahawks will need to sign a new running back to the roster for this upcoming playoff game against the Los Angeles Rams.

title: Rams-Seahawks NFC Championship opening odds
description: Rams are a slight underdog in Part III against their NFC West rival
fullText:
The Los Angeles Rams are a 2.5-point underdog against the Seattle Seahawks in the NFC Championship this Sunday, according to FanDuel Sportsbook. L.A. is coming off a terrible showing in the Divisional Round in Chicago, but will have to step up their game against their red-hot NFC West rival.

Los Angeles defeated the Cardiac Bears 20-17 in overtime over the weekend. The Rams needed a stellar showing from their defense to hold off Caleb Williams’ clutch gene, particularly with Matthew Stafford and the offense struggling with cohesion for much of the game. Similar to the previous win over Carolina, things got ugly late before the veteran team managed to eke out the win.

As mentioned, the Rams will need to bring their A-game in Seattle, as the Hawks are coming off a 41-6 demolition of the woefully undermanned 49ers. L.A. will present a tougher challenge, but not if they play as they did versus Chicago.

Both teams split the season series, with each game decided by a combined three points. Expect another tight battle between the divisional foes with a Super Bowl berth on the line.

title: Hertha BSC in the hunt for out-of-favour Borussia Dortmund defender
description: Borussia Dortmund may have potentially found a suitable buyer for unused left-back Almugera Kabar in the 2. Bundesliga.BILD reports that Hertha BSC are interested in a loan deal for the 19-year-old, b...
fullText:
Borussia Dortmund may have potentially found a suitable buyer for unused left-back Almugera Kabar in the 2. Bundesliga.

BILD reports that Hertha BSC are interested in a loan deal for the 19-year-old, but the player himself is insisting on a permanent transfer.

VfL Wolfsburg and Hamburger SV have already made inquiries, and talks with HSV are reportedly at an advanced stage.

Kabar signed a contract with Dortmund until 2028 just a year ago, but hasn't been getting any playing time under Niko Kovač.

The defender sat on the bench in two of BVB's three opening Bundesliga games and the same against Juventus in the Champions League.

At least in the Regionalliga West, Kabar has racked up 960 minutes of playing time whilst scoring 4 goals and providing an assist.

However, it is clear to all that the youngster is a level above Germany's fourth tier and is looking for a way out in the winter transfer window.

title: Manchester City complete Marc Guehi signing
description: Manchester City have signed England defender Marc Guehi (25) from Crystal Palace in a deal worth an initial £20m, as reported by Sky Sports.The 25-year-old has agreed a five-and-a-half-year contract ...
fullText:
Manchester City have signed England defender Marc Guehi (25) from Crystal Palace in a deal worth an initial £20m, as reported by Sky Sports.

The 25-year-old has agreed a five-and-a-half-year contract at the Etihad Stadium, keeping him at City until 2031, with the deal also including a sell-on clause for Palace.

City moved for Guehi after suffering a number of injuries in defence. The centre-back was out of contract at the end of the season and had been close to joining Liverpool last summer, while Arsenal and Bayern Munich were also interested.

“I am really happy and incredibly proud to be a Manchester City player,” said Guehi. “I am now at the best club in England and part of an unbelievable squad. I can’t wait to get started.”

City manager Pep Guardiola said the transfer was only possible because of Guehi’s contract situation, with several clubs hoping to sign him on a free transfer in the summer. He praised Guehi’s quality and versatility, saying he can play on either side of central defence.

The former Chelsea defender becomes City’s second January signing following the arrival of forward Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth. City’s spending over the past 12 months now stands at around £445m.

Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner criticised the timing of the move, saying his side were “completely abandoned” by the club’s hierarchy after selling their captain so close to a match.

Guehi leaves Palace having established himself as one of the Premier League’s most reliable defenders and a regular for England. For City, he arrives as an experienced option who can make an immediate impact as they continue to compete on multiple fronts.

title: Bills defender reacts to shocking Sean McDermott firing: 'Honestly sickening'
description: The Buffalo Bills shockingly fired Sean McDermott on Monday, and it's safe to say not all players were on board with the decision.
fullText:
Bills defender reacts to shocking Sean McDermott firing: 'Honestly sickening' originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Buffalo Bills shocked the NFL world on Monday morning by firing head coach Sean McDermott.

The move just added to what's already been an insane coaching cycle. McDermott joins John Harbaugh and Mike Tomlin as just some of the notable names who have been fired since the regular season concluded.

McDermott racked up a 105-57 overall record with the Bills, but a lack of postseason success ultimately did the coach in. The Bills lost to the Denver Broncos over the weekend, ending their season prematurely once again.

However, moving on from McDermott certainly isn't a decision every player was in favor of. An anonymous player reportedly responded to the news with "WTF," while defender Jordan Phillips offered an even stronger reaction.

Phillips took to Instagram to voice his displeasure with the move. The defender said “This s**t here is so stupid honestly sickening. The best coach I’ve ever been around."

It's a pretty big compliment for Phillips to say McDermott is the best coach he's been around. Phillips has been in the league since 2015 and has played for four different teams. If Phillips feels this way, it's likely other players do too.

Phillips played in 11 games in 2025 and nine tackles and one sack.

Notably, Phillips is not under contract in 2026, and it certainly seems unlikely he'll be brought back to Buffalo after this.

As for McDermott, the coach will likely have plenty of options. McDermott could be a candidate for one of several head coaching jobs that are still open, or perhaps a coordinator spot. The coach could also choose to sit out in 2026 and see what gigs are open next year.

It will be interesting to see where the Bills go from here. Brian Daboll, who was previously the Bills offensive coordinator, is available, and current offensive coordinator Joe Brady will likely receive an interview as well.

The main priority will be someone who can work with Allen and get the team over the hump and win a Super Bowl. McDermott was an elite regular season head coach, but the postseason disappointments became too much for the team to deal with.

title: Inter vs Arsenal – Clash of the Champions League Titans – Match Preview
description: The stage is set for San Siro to welcome what promises to be an entertaining match between two of the most in-form sides in Europe as Inter welcome Arsenal to Milan.More than that, however, it is an o...
fullText:
The stage is set for San Siro to welcome what promises to be an entertaining match between two of the most in-form sides in Europe as Inter welcome Arsenal to Milan.

More than that, however, it is an opportunity to show credentials for two sides that are both missing a European title in recent years despite dominating the competition.

For Arsenal, who lead the Premier League and Champions League tables, continental silverware has eluded them this century, and is considered to be a high priority for the club and fans alike.

MANCHESTER, ENGLAND – AUGUST 17: Riccardo Calafiori of Arsenal celebrates scoring his team’s first goal with teammate Gabriel Martinelli during the Premier League match between Manchester United and Arsenal at Old Trafford on August 17, 2025 in Manchester, England. (Photo by Michael Regan/Getty Images)

Meanwhile, Inter have lost two of the last three Champions League finals and will have been disappointed not to add another European cup to their trophy cabinet.

So far this season, across 28 games in the Premier League and Europe, Arsenal have conceded just 15 goals. In their six continental games, the Gunners have only conceded once, as their defence continues to prove themselves the best in the world.

Inter, on the other hand, have had no shortage of goals. Head coach Cristian Chivu’s wealth of attacking options have given him 44 goals in Serie A, ten higher than champions Napoli who have the 2nd most goals this campaign.

Whilst they have not been as prolific comparatively in the Champions League, the Nerazzurri have still found the back of the net on 12 occasions in their first six games.

UDINE, ITALY – JANUARY 17: Lautaro Martinez of FC Internazionale celebrates scoring his team’s first goal during the Serie A match between Udinese Calcio and FC Internazionale at Stadio Friuli on January 17, 2026 in Udine, Italy. (Photo by Timothy Rogers/Getty Images)

Therefore, we have a ‘immovable object vs unstoppable force’ scenario here, where Chivu’s free-flowing, goal-scoring Inter will welcome the most impenetrable defence in the competition.

Chivu has options, mind you, something the Gunners can not rely on. Inter have Ange-Yoan Bonny, Francesco Pio Esposito, Marcus Thuram and Lautaro Martinez all available for the fixture, with Pio Esposito and Lautaro starting the last couple of games together and doing well as a partnership.

Arsenal, meanwhile, still face injuries in defence – with Piero Hincapie and former Bologna defender Riccardo Calafiori both set to miss the trip to San Siro. However, both Gabriel and William Saliba are both fit, available and expected to take up their core positions in the heart of Arsenal’s defence.

The last team to defeat Arsenal in a Champions League group stage (or league phase as it is now known) game was Inter last season.

The Gunners have won every game since that occasion, where they lost 1-0 to Simone Inzaghi’s Inter, who won thanks to a penalty from Hakan Calhanoglu.

Inter Milan’s players celebrate the 1-0 goal during the UEFA Champions League soccer match between Inter and Arsenal FC at Giuseppe Meazza stadium in Milan, Italy, 06 November 2024. EPA-EFE/NICOLA MARFISI

Aside from Arsenal’s knockout round exit at the hands of eventual winners PSG, the Nerazzurri are the only other side to have beaten Mikel Arteta’s side in the competitions and therefore there is something extra at stake for both clubs here.

Inter will want to prove that they have not regressed since Inzaghi’s departure last summer, whilst for Arsenal, winning in one of the only stadiums they have slipped up in will give them a further boost in momentum.

title: 💣Will Vasco snap him up? Marino Hinestroza set for Brazil move
description: What seemed like an imminent transfer to Argentina has taken a radical turn. Vasco da Gama intervened at the last minute in the negotiations and managed to finalize the signing of Marino Hinestroza, a...
fullText:
What seemed like an imminent transfer to Argentina has taken a radical turn. Vasco da Gama intervened at the last minute in the negotiations and managed to finalize the signing of Marino Hinestroza, a winger from Atlético Nacional. Despite the player already having an advanced agreement with Boca Juniors, the Brazilian club's financial proposal ultimately convinced the Colombian team's management, leaving the "Xeneize" without their main target.

The Rio de Janeiro team will shell out 5 million dollars (approximately 27 million reais) for the transfer of the Valle del Cauca attacker. The payment is structured in several installments, and when adding the fees and commissions for the intermediaries, the total operation will reach 6 million dollars. This move represents a significant investment for the "Gigante da Colina," which seeks to strengthen its offense for the Brasileirao.

The news hit like a bucket of cold water in Buenos Aires, where the player's arrival for medical exams was even expected this week. The bureaucratic hurdles and differences in the capital gain clauses that delayed the signing with Boca were exploited by Vasco to "attack" the market. Thus, Hinestroza would continue his career in Brazil.

This article was translated into English by Artificial Intelligence. You can read the original version in 🇪🇸 here.

title: Dirk Nowitzki reacts to Kevin Durant passing him on NBA all-time scoring list
description: Dallas Mavericks legend Dirk Nowitzki was in the top six on the NBA’s all-time scoring list, but not anymore.  With his point production during the Houston Rockets’ 119-110 win over the New Orleans Pelicans on Sunday night, Kevin Durant passed Nowitzki and moved into sixth place on the list.  Durant now has 31,562, and counting.
fullText:
Dirk Nowitzki reacts to Kevin Durant passing him on NBA all-time scoring list originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Dallas Mavericks legend Dirk Nowitzki was in the top six on the NBA’s all-time scoring list, but not anymore.

With his point production during the Houston Rockets’ 119-110 win over the New Orleans Pelicans on Sunday night, Kevin Durant passed Nowitzki and moved into sixth place on the list. Nowitzki scored 31,560 points over the course of his career. Durant now has 31,562, and counting.

After the accomplishment, Nowitzki reacted to being passed on the all-time list and congratulated Durant via video.

“Not super happy about him passing me, but, no seriously, to me he is one of the purest, smoothest scorers the game has ever seen. A seven-footer, basically, which he says he’s not. I think he’s a seven-footer with really a two guard’s game.

“The shot making, the off the dribble stuff, the off-balance stuff. There’s really nothing you can do to stop him one-on-one. He can always get a great shot up. … And so it’s been incredible to watch his career… And so, congrats KD. Keep it going. Move up a couple more spots and keep it up. Good luck.”

title: Thilo Kehrer: "We need to be attentive and focused for 90 minutes."
description: On the eve of their European clash against Real Madrid (Tuesday, 9 pm), as part of the 7th matchday of the Champions League, the Monaco central defender spoke at a press conference.It’s a chance to ...
fullText:
On the eve of their European clash against Real Madrid (Tuesday, 9 pm), as part of the 7th matchday of the Champions League, the Monaco central defender spoke at a press conference.

It’s a chance to rise to the occasion. As they prepare to face Real Madrid this Tuesday (21:00) at the Santiago Bernabéu Stadium, the AS Monaco players know that they will have to be at their best and deliver a nearly perfect performance to come away from this match with a positive result. It is certainly with this mindset that they approached the game, and it’s what Thilo Kehrer spoke about in a pre-match press conference ahead of the match. 🎙️

The mindset ahead of this clash against Real Madrid

The team’s morale is quite good; we’re working hard in training to prepare for every match in the same way. We’re always very motivated, and there’s a great deal of focus and competitiveness within the group. For tomorrow, we know we need to concentrate on the areas we can control, namely our performance and the intensity we bring to the pitch. If we manage to put all of that together, we can have a great game and try to get a good result at the Santiago Bernabéu.

This instability in performance between Ligue 1 and the Champions League is difficult to explain. Being able to raise the bar and to this level in big matches and against strong opponents has shown that the potential and quality are present in the team. Tomorrow, we'll need to put in the necessary effort on the pitch, have the right mentality, be competitive, and play together as a united team.

Tomorrow, we’ll need to put in the necessary effort on the pitch, have the right mentality, be competitive, and play together as a united team.

He has excellent finishing skills, which he demonstrates in every attacking play, and that’s something that can help us as a team.

Eric had a good preseason and a good start to the season before his injury. He was then out for three months and has only just returned. With such a long absence, there’s normally a protocol for gradually easing him back into playing. Unfortunately, given our situation, he was forced to play right away. I’m not worried about him; we’ll help him get back into top form, but he’s also an experienced player who has proven his abilities in the past. He shows it every day in training, so there’s no cause for concern.

He's a world-class striker. It will be crucial to limit the space he has to work with. Therefore, we'll need to defend as a team because he, like his attacking teammates, is very difficult to contain individually. We'll have to be attentive and focused for 90 minutes.

title: Under-pressure Frank 'feeling trust' of Spurs board
description: Tottenham head coach Thomas Frank says lunch with board members is an "extremely good sign" despite pressure mounting on him during an underwhelming season.
fullText:
Tottenham head coach Thomas Frank says he is "feeling the trust" of the club's hierarchy despite a disappointing season so far.

BBC Sport understands Frank is under significant scrutiny within the club as they considering ending his seven-month reign.

Spurs have so far backed Frank publicly despite their struggles this season, although Saturday's home defeat by West Ham has added to the pressure on the Dane.

Frank had lunch on Monday with chief executive Vinai Venkatesham, as well as other board members Nick Beucher and Johan Lange, which he said was "all good".

"We had a good conversation about life and football and the future of the club," said Frank at a news conference before Tuesday's Champions League match at home to Borussia Dortmund.

"It is an extremely good sign because normally people run away if there is bad news or bad weather coming, they are normally not coming in and being friendly for lunch."

Spurs chiefs consider sacking Frank as fans turn

Tottenham's Davies to have surgery on broken ankle

At least one member of the club's executive team has actively raised the option of ending Frank's reign in recent weeks.

Spurs are 14th in the Premier League, having won just seven of their 22 games this season, and large sections of the supporters seem to have already lost faith in the former Brentford boss.

He was taunted by his own fans with chants of "you're getting sacked in the morning" at the weekend, but Frank believes he can win back the supporters' faith.

"As long as we win football matches and make sure we win enough of them, everyone will support us," he said.

"It is not about me. It is about supporting the team, the players."

Frank added he only has 11 outfield players from the usual first-team squad available for the match against Dortmund.

Spurs have several players absent through long-term injuries, including Ben Davies, Richarlison, Rodrigo Bentancur, Mohammed Kudus, Dejan Kulusevski and James Maddison.

Midfielder Joao Palhinha is a doubt for Dortmund match, while defender Mickey van de Ven is suspended and new signing Conor Gallagher is ineligible until the knockouts, having already played in the Champions League this season for Atletico Madrid.

He said: "We need everyone to support us from minute one. Especially the team, especially the players. If we get that support, anything can happen. Magic can happen."

Tottenham are 11th in the Champions League and a win against Dortmund is vital to continue their hopes of qualifying automatically for the knockout stages.

title: How is Carson Beck still eligible to play college football for Miami?
description: Miami quarterback Carson Beck recently admitted that he graduated. So, how is he still playing college football?
fullText:
As the No. 10 Miami Hurricanes prepare to play the No. 1 Indiana Hoosiers in the College Football Playoff national championship on Monday at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, Florida, they'll be led by quarterback Carson Beck.

If you're here, you might be wondering: How is Beck, who played four seasons at Georgia and already graduated, still eligible to play?

MORE CFB: Can Indiana, Miami football players still enter the transfer portal?

Here's the answer: According to Beck, he still has eligibility because he's enrolled in classes.

"Obviously, I've been working towards other degrees now that I've gotten to Miami, but these programs take a little longer than just a year to finish," Beck told the media this week. "Obviously, I'm not enrolling again [in the spring] semester. So, I'll be done after this season."

There you have it. Enjoy the national title game, folks!

This article originally appeared on For The Win: How is Miami QB Carson Beck still eligible to play college football?

title: Michigan Men’s, Women’s Basketball both move up in the AP Poll
description: Both the Michigan men’s and women’s basketball teams moved up in the AP Poll after solid respective weeks:
fullText:
With Monday afternoon comes two new Associated Press Polls, a weekly winter tradition around these parts. After solid respective weeks, both the Michigan men’s and women’s basketball teams went up in the polls — the men’s team went from No. 4 to No. 3, while the women’s team went from No. 8 to No. 7.

For the second straight year, the men’s team went undefeated on its now annual West Coast trip, beating both Washington and Oregon by 10 points. What also helped Michigan move up the AP Poll is former No. 2 Iowa State losing twice last week; the Cyclones moved all the way down to No. 9 this week.

The Wolverines are still the darlings of the advanced analytics community, still ranking No. 1 in KenPom, No. 1 in Bart Torvik, and No. 1 on EvanMiya.com. They are also still No. 1 in the NET rankings, and they would benefit from Wisconsin — which had 61 votes in this poll, the most of any unranked team — continuing to win and help their tournament case a bit.

The men’s team is back home this week, with two games against teams in the top-40 on KenPom. Michigan faces Indiana on Tuesday, Jan. 20 (7 p.m., Peacock) and Ohio State on Friday, Jan. 23 (8 p.m., FOX).

Meanwhile, the women’s team played one game last week, defeating No. 25 Illinois, 85-69. Olivia Olson led the way with 21 points in that game, with Te’yala Delfosse not far behind with 15 points off the bench.

Halfway through the regular season, the Wolverines are No. 6 in the NET, the equivalent of being a 2-seed come the NCAA Tournament.

An hour after this article is published, Michigan will play its first game against a top-five team since losing in thrilling fashion to No. 1 UConn in late November. Michigan faces No. 5 Vanderbilt at the Coretta Scott King Classic in Newark, New Jersey (2:30 p.m., FOX). The Wolverines stay in New Jersey to face Rutgers on Thursday, Jan. 22 (6 p.m. EST on Big Ten Network) and then return home on Sunday to take on a USC team without Juju Watkins (2 p.m. EST on Big Ten Network).

title: Why Ubuntu in a Container Isn't Ubuntu
description: A deep dive into how OS base images like Ubuntu work in Docker containers. Learn why containers share the host kernel, how they differ from VMs, why they're so efficient, and how many you can theoretically run on a single machine.
fullText:
When you run docker run ubuntu, you're not running Ubuntu. You're running your host's Linux kernel with Ubuntu's userland tools layered on top. Understanding this distinction unlocks the real power of containers.

Let's start with what happens when you execute this command:

You get a bash prompt that looks like Ubuntu. You can run apt update, install packages, and everything behaves as expected. But here's the twist:

The kernel is from your host machine. The "Ubuntu" part is just the filesystem - the binaries, libraries, and configuration files that make up Ubuntu's userland.

The following diagram illustrates the fundamental architectural difference between virtual machines and containers. VMs virtualize hardware, while containers virtualize the operating system.

When you pull ubuntu:22.04, you're downloading a tarball containing:

The C library (glibc) and other shared libraries that programs link against:

System configuration that defines behavior:

The dpkg/apt database that tracks installed packages:

This is the critical insight. The Linux kernel provides:

When a container process calls open(), read(), or fork(), those calls go directly to the host kernel. The kernel doesn't know or care that the process came from an "Ubuntu container" or an "Alpine container."

This diagram shows what happens when a containerized application makes a system call. The call passes through the container runtime's namespace isolation but ultimately reaches the same host kernel.

The Linux syscall ABI is remarkably stable. A binary compiled against glibc 2.31 (Ubuntu 20.04) will work on a kernel from Ubuntu 24.04 because:

This is why you can run Ubuntu 18.04 containers on a host running kernel 6.5 - the syscall interface remains compatible.

Let's prove this with a hands-on example. This script runs the same kernel query across different base images to demonstrate that they all share the host kernel.

Every container reports the exact same kernel version because they're all running on the same kernel.

A VM must load an entire kernel into memory (~100-500MB). With 10 VMs, you have 10 kernels consuming memory. With 10 containers, you have one kernel.

VMs must boot: BIOS → bootloader → kernel → init system → services. Containers just call fork() and exec() - the process exists in milliseconds.

This comparison shows startup time differences between VMs and containers. VMs must complete a full boot sequence, while containers start almost instantly.

When you run 100 containers from ubuntu:22.04, the base image layers exist only once on disk. Each container gets a thin copy-on-write layer for its changes.

This diagram shows how Docker's layered filesystem works. Base image layers are shared and read-only, while each container gets its own thin writable layer.

The kernel's page cache is shared. If 50 containers read the same file, the kernel caches it once. If containers use the same shared libraries (and they often do), those memory pages can be shared via copy-on-write.

For a standard 16GB RAM VM, here's a realistic calculation:

The following script demonstrates the theoretical maximum number of minimal containers you can run on a system with available memory.

A practical limit for a 16GB VM running real workloads:

Linux maintains a stable syscall interface. Key points:

Rare cases where containers might fail:

Kernel feature requirements: Container needs a feature your kernel lacks

Kernel module dependencies: Some software needs specific kernel modules

Seccomp/capability restrictions: Host may block syscalls the container needs

The choice of base image affects:

This Dockerfile demonstrates using scratch (empty) base image for maximum efficiency. Only works with statically compiled binaries that have no external dependencies.

For a deeper dive into choosing and optimizing base images, see How to Containerize Python Apps with Multi-Stage Dockerfiles.

Understanding the boundary between userland and kernel clarifies container behavior:

The kernel provides namespaces to make containers feel isolated:

The kernel maintains a mapping: container PID 1 → host PID 45678. This is how isolation works without virtualization.

If your host kernel has a vulnerability, every container is exposed. Keep hosts patched.

Want to use io_uring? Your host kernel needs 5.1+. Want eBPF features? Need kernel 4.15+ with specific options enabled.

Alpine uses musl libc. Some binaries compiled for glibc won't work:

From the kernel's perspective, there's no difference between an "Ubuntu container" and a "Debian container." They're both just processes making syscalls.

Containers are processes with fancy isolation. VMs virtualize hardware and run separate kernels.

All containers share the host kernel. The "OS" in the container is just userland files.

You're running your host's kernel with Ubuntu's tools. If your host is Debian, you're really running Debian's kernel.

Base images contain the minimum userland tools. No kernel, no bootloader, no drivers.

Shared layers and kernel page caching mean containers often share memory efficiently.

Docker base images are filesystem snapshots of Linux distributions' userland components - the binaries, libraries, and configurations that make Ubuntu feel like Ubuntu. But the actual operating system - the kernel - is shared with the host.

The trade-off is weaker isolation than VMs - containers share a kernel, so kernel exploits affect all containers. For most workloads, this trade-off is worth it.

Need to monitor your containerized workloads? OneUptime provides comprehensive container monitoring with resource tracking, log aggregation, and intelligent alerting - whether you're running 10 containers or 10,000.

@nawazdhandala • Jan 19, 2026 •
